data.title: Homepage
data.text:
EMC² is offering high-potential organisations like yours funded mentoring, access to peer networks, and more.

We are an East Midlands creative consortium funded by the Department for Digital, Culture, Media & Sport.

EMC² has £1.2m of funding to help regional businesses prepare to accelerate ahead.

EMC² will be focussed on areas where specific advice is needed.

For example, we may cover intellectual property, business models, revenue streams, and access to new markets.

There will also be the chance to bid for funding from Innovate UK.

EMC² wants to develop innovative and creative ideas.

We will use Create Growth funding to help you form winning strategies needed to expand operations, attract finance, and create jobs.

Our programme launched in November 2022 and is open to businesses in:

Our targeted support will prepare East Midlands creative businesses as they apply for funding.

Participants can also aim to tap into a £7m pot being managed by Innovate UK, as well as introductions to local and national investors.

Support will be provided to selected businesses who can demonstrate that funding will act as a stimulus for growth and further investment.

EMC² aims to support 100 creative businesses across three years. We are opening applications across four cohort groups, each of up to 25 businesses.

The investment is aimed at creative businesses in the East Midlands with high-growth potential which have yet to reach the scaling stage.

Eligible businesses should ideally:

Be registered or trading within Leicester, Leicestershire, Derby, Derbyshire, Lincoln, Greater Lincolnshire, or Rutland

Be sole traders or businesses having been trading for at least 2 years and with the potential to scale up.

Please contact us if you think you may be eligible.

East Midlands Creative Coalition (EMC²) is a community of organisations from the East Midlands. Members include local authorities, universities, local enterprise partnerships, and many other organisations in the private, public and voluntary sector.

We were accepted for inclusion in the Government’s Create Growth Programme following a successful funding bid led by the Leicester and Leicestershire Enterprise Partnership (LLEP).
